intro: Scleranthus semiglaber, commonly known as the smooth sow-thistle, is an annual herbaceous plant native to temperate regions of Europe and Asia. It typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, featuring slender, erect stems covered with fine, short hairs. The plant has alternate, ovate to lanceolate leaves that are usually hairy on the underside. Its small, yellow flowers are arranged in loose clusters and bloom from late spring to early summer. Scleranthus semiglaber is often found in disturbed soils, such as roadsides and fields, and is known for its rapid growth and ability to colonize open areas.
